did.unittitle: Chemical Education Material Study and Chemical Bond Approach Project records

bioghist.p: Chemical Education Material Study (CHEM Study) and the Chemical Bond Approach (CBA) Project were two efforts begun in the late 1950s to develop new approaches to teaching chemistry to secondary students. CHEM Study was established in 1959 on the basis of a recommendation by an ad hoc committee of the American Chemical Society. CBA was first developed in 1959.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials from both the CHEM Study and the CBA projects. The CHEM Study materials include: teaching guides, scripts, French translations of scripts, and listings of CHEM Study filmstrips; copies of a grant proposal to NSF; newsletters; articles on CHEM Study; exams; and documents relating to lawsuits stemming from laboratory accidents. The CBA materials include: drafts of teacher's guides and textbooks; newsletters and brochures; exams; and a list of participating schools and teachers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: Chemical Bond Approach Project records (06:061); Joseph S. Schmuckler papers (05:073); Laurence E. Strong papers (93:04); Frank Henry Verhoek papers (includes some CBA) (96:03).
